author: Patricia Traina For the Journal Inquirer
title: Can’t live in the past
text:
Previous Next Inspecting the troops 
Tom Coughlin is urging his players to keep their chins up and focus on getting their division record back to 2-2 when they face the Cowboys on Sunday. (Associated Press) Posted: Saturday, October 24, 2015 12:50 am Can’t live in the past By Patricia Traina For the Journal Inquirer Journal Inquirer | 0 comments 
New York Giants quarterback Eli Manning didn’t blink or miss a beat when he was asked by a reporter how the Giants, coming off a 27-7 primetime meltdown against the Philadelphia Eagles on Monday night, can avoid falling into another rut as they did last year when a loss to the Eagles sparked a seven-game losing streak. 
“Go out and play the next game,” he said, referring to this weekend’s home contest against the Dallas Cowboys. “[Last year is] the last thing on our mind; we’re not thinking about that.” 
The Giants might want to give some thought to last year because as the late philosopher George Santayana once said, “Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.” kAm(92E 92AA6?65 =2DE J62C — 2?5 H92E 9625 4@249 %@> r@F89=:? :D DFC6=J 9@A:?8 5@6D ?@E 92AA6? 282:?
